moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4: I start out with my favorite opening, the queen's gambit.
moves.2... dxc4 3. e3: I prepare to win back the pawn and put my LSB in a nice spot.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Bxc4 Nf6 5. d5: ?! this isn't so great, better would have been just developing or playing Qb3, a trappy move that threatens Bxf7+. I know that moves that make traps aren't great, but I don't think it would damage my position either.
moves.5... Ne5 6. b3: I prepare to fianchetto my DSB on a long diagonal.
moves.6... e6 7. dxe6 Bxe6 8. Bxe6 fxe6: Somehow I'm behind in development, my position isn't great.
moves.9. Bb2 Qxd1+ 10. Kxd1 O-O-O+ 11. Nd2: Now, I'm starting to catch up but I can't castle.
moves.11... Ne4 12. Bxe5: ?? I thought all he could do is win it back with Rxd2+, but I missed the fork.
moves.13. Ke1 Nxh1: There goes my rook, but if I'm lucky I can trap his knight.
moves.14. Rc1 Bd6 15. Bxd6: Trades are bad when you're behind, but if I moved my bishop he could take my h pawn.
moves.15... Rxd6 16. Kf1: My king inches closer to try to trap, but this is a huge ????????????????????????????????????? because it undefends my d knight.
moves.16... Rxd2 17. Nf3 Rf8: Ouch, that was a strong move and the best I can do is to trap his knight.
moves.18. Kg1 Rxa2: ?? loses the knight, better would have been Nf2.
moves.22... Kb7 23. h4 Rgh2+ 24. Kg1 Rxh4: I resign, because I don't think I have any hope. Now for game two.
